description: Advanced GraphQL queries for cppgraphqlgen implementation

queries.name: Simple Query - Get All Users
queries.query: query { users { id name email age } }
queries.description: Fetch all users with their basic information

queries.name: Query with Variables
queries.query: query GetUser($userId: Int!) { user(id: $userId) { id name email age } }
queries.description: Fetch a specific user by ID using variables

queries.name: Nested Query - Users with Posts
queries.query: query { users { id name email posts { id title content } } }
queries.description: Fetch users with their associated posts (nested relationship)

queries.name: Query with Fragments
queries.query: fragment UserInfo on User { id name email age } query { users { ...UserInfo } }
queries.description: Use fragments to reuse field selections

queries.name: Query with Aliases
queries.query: query { firstUser: user(id: 1) { id name } secondUser: user(id: 2) { id name } }
queries.description: Use aliases to fetch multiple users in one query

queries.name: Posts with Author Information
queries.query: query { posts { id title content author { id name email } } }
queries.description: Fetch posts with nested author information

queries.name: Introspection - Schema Types
queries.query: query { __schema { types { name kind description } } }
queries.description: Introspect the schema to see all available types

queries.name: Introspection - Query Type
queries.query: query { __schema { queryType { name fields { name type { name kind } } } } }
queries.description: Introspect available queries

queries.name: Introspection - Specific Type
queries.query: query { __type(name: "User") { name fields { name type { name kind } } } }
queries.description: Introspect a specific type definition

queries.name: Create User Mutation
queries.query: mutation { createUser(input: { name: "John Doe", email: "john@example.com", age: 30 }) { id name email age } }
queries.description: Create a new user

queries.name: Create User with Variables
queries.query: mutation CreateUser($input: CreateUserInput!) { createUser(input: $input) { id name email age } }
queries.description: Create a new user using input variables

queries.name: Update User Mutation
queries.query: mutation { updateUser(input: { id: 1, name: "Alice Updated", age: 31 }) { id name email age } }
queries.description: Update an existing user

queries.name: Create Post Mutation
queries.query: mutation { createPost(input: { title: "New Post", content: "This is a new post", authorId: 1 }) { id title content authorId } }
queries.description: Create a new post

queries.name: Delete User Mutation
queries.query: mutation { deleteUser(id: 3) }
queries.description: Delete a user by ID

queries.name: Complex Query with Multiple Operations
queries.query: query GetUserAndPosts($userId: Int!) { user(id: $userId) { id name email posts { id title } } allPosts: posts { id title author { name } } }
queries.description: Combine multiple queries with aliases and nested fields

queries.name: Conditional Fields with Directives
queries.query: query GetUser($userId: Int!, $includePosts: Boolean!) { user(id: $userId) { id name email posts @include(if: $includePosts) { id title } } }
queries.description: Use @include directive to conditionally fetch fields

queries.name: Skip Fields with Directives
queries.query: query GetUsers($skipEmail: Boolean!) { users { id name email @skip(if: $skipEmail) age } }
queries.description: Use @skip directive to conditionally exclude fields

queries.name: Multiple Fragments
queries.query: fragment BasicUserInfo on User { id name } fragment ContactInfo on User { email } query { users { ...BasicUserInfo ...ContactInfo age } }
queries.description: Use multiple fragments in a single query

queries.name: Inline Fragments
queries.query: query { posts { id title ... on Post { content author { name } } } }
queries.description: Use inline fragments for type-specific fields

queries.name: Batch Mutations
queries.query: mutation { user1: createUser(input: { name: "User 1", email: "user1@example.com" }) { id } user2: createUser(input: { name: "User 2", email: "user2@example.com" }) { id } }
queries.description: Execute multiple mutations in a single request

curl_examples.name: Simple Query
curl_examples.command: curl -k -X POST https://localhost:8443/graphql -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"query": "{ users { id name email } }"}'

curl_examples.name: Query with Variables
curl_examples.command: curl -k -X POST https://localhost:8443/graphql -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"query": "query GetUser($userId: Int!) { user(id: $userId) { id name } }", "variables": {"userId": 1}}'

curl_examples.name: Mutation
curl_examples.command: curl -k -X POST https://localhost:8443/graphql -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"query": "mutation { createUser(input: { name: \"Test User\", email: \"test@example.com\" }) { id name } }"}'

curl_examples.name: Introspection
curl_examples.command: curl -k -X POST https://localhost:8443/graphql -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"query": "{ __schema { types { name } } }"}'
